com.kontakt.sdk.android.ble.spec

Enum KontaktDeviceCharacteristic

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<KontaktDeviceCharacteristic>
      • com.kontakt.sdk.android.ble.spec.KontaktDeviceCharacteristic
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<KontaktDeviceCharacteristic>

    public enum KontaktDeviceCharacteristic
extends java.lang.Enum<KontaktDeviceCharacteristic>
    IBeaconCharacteristic The Name enums depict specification given in kontakt.io Beacon specification - version 2.
    More precisely each Name enum describes characteristic with its name, Id, and order in service that it belongs to.
    See Also:
    kontakt.io Beacon specification - version 2.

      ACCELEROMETER
      The Accelerometer characteristic.
      ACTIVE_PROFILE
      Allows to switch profile that the BLE device is transmitting.
      ADVERTISING_INTERVAL
      The ADVERTISING_INTERVAL characteristic provides access to beacon advertising interval.

      The APPEARANCE characteristic provides appearance of Beacon device.

      The BATTERY_LEVEL characteristic provides access to measured battery level described in percentage value.

        The SLAVE_PREFERRED_CONNECTION_PARAMETERS provides connection parameters in slave role. (Service 1, Characteristic 3)

      • BOOTLOADER

        public static final KontaktDeviceCharacteristic BOOTLOADER
        The BOOTLOADER characteristic allows to enable bootloader mode.

      • NON_CONNECTABLE_MODE

        public static final KontaktDeviceCharacteristic NON_CONNECTABLE_MODE
        The NON_CONNECTABLE_MODE characteristic allows to beacon's transition into non-connectable mode. In this mode beacon is propagating advertising package for 20 minutes. Authorization with beacon is not possible. This characteristic is accessible from 2.6 firmware

      • ACTIVE_PROFILE

        public static final KontaktDeviceCharacteristic ACTIVE_PROFILE
        Allows to switch profile that the BLE device is transmitting. Currently, there is possibility to switch between iBeacon and Eddystone profiles.

        The secure control point characteristic

      • GATEWAY_NETWORKS_LENGTH

        public static final KontaktDeviceCharacteristic GATEWAY_NETWORKS_LENGTH
        Read will initialize SeenNetworks array. This array will be sorted by RSSI (highest on index 0). It is guaranteed that SeenNetworks array won't change between reads of this characteristic.

      • GATEWAY_NETWORKS_INDEX

        public static final KontaktDeviceCharacteristic GATEWAY_NETWORKS_INDEX
        Selects network from array to read.

      • GATEWAY_NETWORKS_RECORD

        public static final KontaktDeviceCharacteristic GATEWAY_NETWORKS_RECORD
        Will contain information about selected network. Short and urgent data like RSSI will be placed first to allow shorter reads (like Rssi, Security and first NetworkName characters) Read long can be used to read whole information.

      • KDFU_COMMAND

        public static final KontaktDeviceCharacteristic KDFU_COMMAND
        Kontakt DFU Service command characteristic

      • KDFU_RESPONSE

        public static final KontaktDeviceCharacteristic KDFU_RESPONSE
        Kontakt DFU Service response characteristic

      • KDFU_DATA

        public static final KontaktDeviceCharacteristic KDFU_DATA
        Kontakt DFU Service data characteristic
